newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: OSCE tells Belarus to respect democracy.
newsitem.headline: OSCE tells Belarus to respect democracy.

text.p: Europe's biggest security organisation told Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko on Tuesday to bring back democracy and respect the constitution to end the crisis in the former Soviet republic.
Leading countries from the Organisation for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) urged Lukashenko to "take action without delay" in a statement issued at a European security summit in Lisbon.

The statement was issued by foreign ministers of three countries -- Hungary, Switzerland and Denmark -- which currently guide OSCE policy as the so-called "troika". The OSCE monitors human rights and democracy throughout Europe.
It said the recent referendum which Lukashenko used in an attempt to enhance his powers "was conducted in contradiction with constitutional procedures and cannot be considered as legitimate".

The statement urged Lukashenko to engage in political dialogue with his opposition, allow freedom of the media and "re-establish full respect for internationally accepted democratic and constitutional principles and practices".
